Based on their message, they seem interested in musicals. Here are a few recommendations from this genre:

  * La La Land (2016): A romantic musical directed by Damien Chalamet and starring Emma Stone as the aspiring actress.
  * Mamma Mia! (2008): A musical comedy film based on the play of the same name, which is written by British playwright Tony Award winner Christopher Connelly. The film stars Amanda Seager as the young and ambitious daughter of a hotelier in Greece, who decides to travel back in time to the year 1956 when her mother had just opened up a hotel called "Mamma Mia!" on the Greek island of Crete.
  * Mamma Mia! Here We Go Again (2018): A musical comedy film based on the play of the same name, which is written by British playwright Tony Award winner Christopher Connelly. The film stars Amanda Seager as the young and ambitious daughter of a hotelier in Greece, who decides to travel back in time to the year 1956 when her mother had just opened up a hotel called "Mamma Mia!" on the Greek island of Crete.
  * Once (2008): A musical drama film directed by Kevin Macdonald and starring Ryan Gosling as an aspiring actor who moves to Hollywood with his girlfriend, which leads him into a series of unpredictable events that ultimately change his life.

Once is a musical film directed by Richard Linklater. The movie tells the story of two young musicians, Austin and Sam, who are struggling to make ends meet in the city of Los Angeles.

The movie features original songs written by Linlinklater himself along with other talented musicians. 

Overall, Once is a beautiful and poignant musical film that has captured the hearts of audiences around the world.
